children.comments:
Allows users to throw errors on the error channel of the
asynchronous computation. See documentation in `purescript-transformers`.
children.title: monadThrowAff

children.comments:
Allows users to catch errors on the error channel of the
asynchronous computation. See documentation in `purescript-transformers`.
children.title: monadErrorAff

declarations.comments:
An asynchronous computation with effects `e`. The computation either
errors or produces a value of type `a`.

This is moral equivalent of `ErrorT (ContT Unit (Eff e)) a`.
declarations.title: Aff

declarations.comments:
A pure asynchronous computation, having no effects other than
asynchronous computation.
declarations.title: PureAff

declarations.comments:
A canceler is an asynchronous function that can be used to attempt the
cancelation of a computation. Returns a boolean flag indicating whether
or not the cancellation was successful. Many computations may be composite,
in such cases the flag indicates whether any part of the computation was
successfully canceled. The flag should not be used for communication.
declarations.title: Canceler

declarations.comments: Unwraps the canceler function from the newtype that wraps it.
declarations.title: cancel

declarations.comments:
This function allows you to attach a custom canceler to an asynchronous
computation. If the computation is canceled, then the custom canceler
will be run along side the computation's own canceler.
declarations.title: cancelWith

declarations.comments:
Converts the asynchronous computation into a synchronous one. All values
are ignored, and if the computation produces an error, it is thrown.

Catching exceptions by using `catchException` with the resulting Eff
computation is not recommended, as exceptions may end up being thrown
asynchronously, in which case they cannot be caught.

If you do need to handle exceptions, you can use `runAff` instead, or
you can handle the exception within the Aff computation, using
`catchError` (or any of the other mechanisms).
declarations.title: launchAff

declarations.comments:
Runs the asynchronous computation. You must supply an error callback and a
success callback.

Returns a canceler that can be used to attempt cancellation of the
asynchronous computation.
declarations.title: runAff

declarations.comments:
Creates an asynchronous effect from a function that accepts error and
success callbacks. This function can be used for asynchronous computations
that cannot be canceled.
declarations.title: makeAff

declarations.comments:
Creates an asynchronous effect from a function that accepts error and
success callbacks, and returns a canceler for the computation. This
function can be used for asynchronous computations that can be canceled.
declarations.title: makeAff'

declarations.comments: Pauses execuation of the current computation for the specified number of milliseconds.
declarations.title: delay

declarations.comments: Compute `aff1`, followed by `aff2` regardless of whether `aff1` terminated successfully.
declarations.title: finally

declarations.comments:
Forks the specified asynchronous computation so subsequent computations
will not block on the result of the computation.

Returns a canceler that can be used to attempt cancellation of the
forked computation.
declarations.title: forkAff

declarations.comments:
Forks many asynchronous computation in a synchronous manner while being
stack-safe up to the selected Foldable instance.

Returns a canceler that can be used to attempt cancellation of all
forked computations.
declarations.title: forkAll

declarations.comments: Promotes any error to the value level of the asynchronous monad.
declarations.title: attempt

declarations.comments: Ignores any errors.
declarations.title: apathize

declarations.comments: Lifts a synchronous computation and makes explicit any failure from exceptions.
declarations.title: liftEff'

declarations.comments: A constant canceller that always returns false.
declarations.title: nonCanceler

children.comments: Returns the first value, or the first error if both error.
children.title: altParAff

modules.name: Control.Monad.Aff.AVar
modules.comments: A low-level primitive for building asynchronous code.

declarations.comments: Makes a new asynchronous avar.
declarations.title: makeVar

declarations.comments: Makes a avar and sets it to some value.
declarations.title: makeVar'

declarations.comments: Takes the next value from the asynchronous avar.
declarations.title: takeVar

declarations.comments: Reads a value from the asynchronous var but does not consume it.
declarations.title: peekVar

declarations.comments:
Puts a new value into the asynchronous avar. If the avar has
been killed, this will result in an error.
declarations.title: putVar

declarations.comments: Modifies the value at the head of the avar (will suspend until one is available).
declarations.title: modifyVar

declarations.comments: Kills an asynchronous avar.
declarations.title: killVar

declarations.comments:
The `CONSOLE` effect represents those computations which write to the
console.
declarations.title: CONSOLE

declarations.comments: Write a message to the console. Shorthand for `liftEff $ log x`.
declarations.title: log

declarations.comments:
Write a value to the console, using its `Show` instance to produce a
`String`. Shorthand for `liftEff $ logShow x`.
declarations.title: logShow

declarations.comments: Write a warning to the console. Shorthand for `liftEff $ warn x`.
declarations.title: warn

declarations.comments:
Write a warning value to the console, using its `Show` instance to produce
a `String`. Shorthand for `liftEff $ warnShow x`.
declarations.title: warnShow

declarations.comments: Write an error to the console. Shorthand for `liftEff $ error x`.
declarations.title: error

declarations.comments:
Write an error value to the console, using its `Show` instance to produce a
`String`. Shorthand for `liftEff $ errorShow x`.
declarations.title: errorShow

declarations.comments: Write an info message to the console. Shorthand for `liftEff $ info x`.
declarations.title: info

declarations.comments:
Write an info value to the console, using its `Show` instance to produce a
`String`. Shorthand for `liftEff $ infoShow x`.
declarations.title: infoShow
